Author: Mick de Graaf | Dexwallet#8098
Content: Hi hi. Quick question: how are the random numbers generated for the betting results?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: entropy utxo are created (with hash of entropy)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: player selects a random one and attaches his entropy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: both are combined to create the two values (entropy revealed)

Author: Mick de Graaf | Dexwallet#8098
Content: Aha nice! thanks for the quick answer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so provably fair, immediately revealed, jointly calculated

Author: Mick de Graaf | Dexwallet#8098
Content: Another question hehe. What if I place a bet  await the result and if I lose 51% attack the network to revert the tx before it the blockhash is submitted to the komodo chain? Would my loss be reverted?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if a 51% attack is detected, then it is canceled

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the first bet would stand

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is not about the tx confirming . or not, but the usage of the entropy tx

Author: Mick de Graaf | Dexwallet#8098
Content: Ok thanks. Sounds interesting. Will read up on it

Author: 0x03#8822
Content:
**Attention miners! Should you currently be mining on kmdice.komodopool.xyz (or have kmdice.komodopool.xyz set as one of your backup pools) - this one is for you!**
Effective now, the main pool host has been migrated to `kmdice.pool-mining.xyz`. The port number for the high diff/NH/MRR port has been changed from 18888 to 8889. Please adapt your miner configs accordingly and reconnect as soon as possible!
Additionally, the pool is now reachable within TOR directly: http://fkusu6b4kuadebew.onion (if you're really brave you can mine to the onion host as well, it works, but it's not recommended)
The old infrastructure will stay online for about a week to not interfere with anybodys potentially open NH/MRR orders. Thank you!
BTW and the new pool website is https://kmdice.pool-mining.xyz

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
If someone can describe model by which it's possible to make blackjack game logic on current DiceCC - I can  connect some simple GUI like this: https://github.com/momo-ozawa/blackjack-gui. It shouldn't take much time.

I don't see any ways how it's possible to make blackjack on DiceCC RPC calls - maybe somebody else see

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
because it's 2 numbers and the 2nd is higher or lower than the 1st, you can't
especially since the 1st is static based on odds

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
I see one way of cards drawing but it need very reliable and fast response from DiceCC (now result may be void and changes on next call what is not suitiable):
Full deck
1) Making dicebet with some not significant sum like a 0.0001 on odds 52
If first bet won you draw 2 of hearts, if second you draw 3 of hearts... if only 52th - it's ace of spades

on  next draw you do same but up to 51 and keep in memory that you have one card less now

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: And so on

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Since its' without edge these "service RNG calls" will give 50/50 result

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: But it burns txfee on each card draw. Hope oneday someone will make a new VegasCC contract which will allow to create games (CC should combine adjustable RNG which returns random things from diapason/list + ability to create games and accept buyins  / make payout)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I think in theory it's possible to make "gambling-complete" CC on which will be possible to implement any game based on odds and payouts

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: I agree, it could be done with CC; I just don't see a way to do BJ with DiceCC

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Yup, I think the same. Just wanted to explain for those who are waiting for blackjack or something else like this ğŸ˜ƒ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: DiceCC just very confusing naming for current contract functionality imo. People imagine usual dice - usual dice return you a number in range of dice edges. Current contract saying did you win or lose, it's something like a WinLoseCC

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: You even can't make usual dice (craps) casino game on DiceCC because you need to know exact number
